page.title: 10Norman Church Ravensthorpe
page.content: The church of Saint Denys has stood here for 800 years,but the present building of brown ironstone dates from the 13th and 14th centuries.It is in good condition apart from the stone weathering outside.The absence of a Lord of the Manor has meant that the interior is free from memorials,which adds to its attractive simplicity.There is a massive iron bound chest about 400 years old with 6 locks.The silver chalice and patten,regularly used,date back to 1682. In 1982 the vicar wrote a play about how the village subscribed to the chalice,and it was performed by church members.There is an extensive churchyard which is the parish burial ground with a corner set aside for the burial of ashes.The grounds are kept tidy by voluntary effort and it is hoped to repair the boundary wall in the near future.
